name: Carolina Style Ribs
author: Steve Watson
summary: Mustard based sauces are definitively South Carolina. This one will definitely satisfy your needs. This is for the big fatty ribs, not the baby backs. Do not trim the fat from the ribs. This method renders out fat and keeps ribs moist. If you do not have a smoker available, this can also be done in the oven.
ingredients: ½ cup barbeque seasoning, or to taste
directions: In a medium bowl, whisk together the brown sugar, lemon juice, white vinegar, cider vinegar, Worcestershire sauce, molasses and mustard
Season with granulated garlic, salt, pepper, red pepper flakes, white pepper and cayenne pepper, and mix well
Preheat an outdoor grill or smoker to 225 to 250 degrees F (110 to 120 degrees C)
Rub ribs liberally with barbeque seasoning, then place them in the smoker or grill, and cover
Cook for 4 hours, or until very tender
The meat will easily separate from the bone
Baste ribs with mustard sauce liberally during the final 30 minutes
Heat remaining sauce to a boil, and serve on the side
